did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: Collection consists of business records, subject files, correspondence, newspaper/magazine clippings, and speeches.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George Norman Gill was the editor of the Pulitzer-Prize winning Louisville Courier-Journal. He rose from copy-editor to managing editor, ultimately successfully steering the newspaper through its tumultuous 1986 sale from the Bingham family to the Gannett Corporation. When the Bingham family sold the paper to Gannett in 1986, Gill was named publisher and president until his retirement in 1993.

The paper won ten Pulitzer Prizes, the first in 1918, for the editorial writing of Henry Watterson and subsequently for public service, local general news, feature photography, international reporting and in 2005 for the editorial cartooning of Nick Anderson. During the editorial tenure of Barry Bingham, Sr. the paper was considered Kentucky's "Newspaper of Record" and consistently ranked among the 10 best in the nation.

Gill and his wife, Kay (Baldwin) Gill, met at Indiana University where both studied journalism as winners of Ernie Pyle Scholarships and both served as editors of the Indiana Daily Student. In 1984, Gill received the Indiana University Distinguished Alumni Service Award, the university's highest alumni honor.

A Navy veteran of the Korean Conflict, his many community contributions included serving as president of the Louisville Chamber of Commerce, chairman of the board for the American Printing House for the Blind, president of the Louisville Rotary Club and campaign chairman for the United Way.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Business Records; II. Subject Files; III. Correspondence; IV. Speeches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Business records include legal documents, memoranda, notes, and newspaper and magazine clippings related mainly to the Bingham family businesses. Subject files include memoranda and notes from The Courier-Journal and The Louisville Times, as well as George Gill's personal files. Correspondents include Robert S. Allison, Floyd G. Arpan, Barry Bingham, Frederick A. Colwell, John Jay Hooker, Paul Janensch, Alex S. Jones, Lawrence Long, Jan Morgan, Ed Owens, Hunter S. Thompson, and Mansir J. Tydings. Speeches include copies of speeches given by George Gill as well as accompanying correspondence.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Gill, G. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically. Includes items relating to the Bingham Family businesses (The Courier-Journal, The Louisville Times, WHAS-AM/WAMZ-FM, WHAS-TV, Standard Gravure) before, during, and after the sale and split of the businesses. The majority of the coverage concerns the sale of the The Courier-Journal and The Louisville Times to Gannett Co., Inc. and the years after. This series also includes intra-family documents attempting to resolve stake-holder issues prior to Barry Bingham, Sr.'s decision to sell all of the family businesses.
